intro: Lardizabala triternata, commonly known as the Andean arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are used as a starch source. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique properties, it is also valued for its potential in traditional medicine and as a sustainable food crop.
